t: SNL's roast of Amazon’s "grab and go" stores reveals a sad truth about shopping in America
s: The commercial cuts to a Black customer, portrayed by SNL legend Kenan Thompson, who says, “Oh so you want me to just take something and walk out? Nah son,” he says, an implied reference to the racial bias Black and brown shoppers face in the United States. Similarly, Kravitz’s character, shopping with a white partner (Andrew Dismukes), spots her “favorite brand ...

t: The Simple Brilliance of That Amazon Go 'SNL' Sketch - The Atlantic
s: March 14, 2022 - Amazon Go doesn’t charge customers for items they put back on the shelf, and the commercial played on all the ways that decision could go wrong for some buyers. t: Companies Get Massive Brand Recognition With SNL Product Placement Parody Fun
s: April 16, 2021 - For as long as the show has been around, it has been making parodies of pop culture, celebrities and of course advertising. In this blog, Hollywood Branded looks at the top 7 times SNL Product Placement parody of popular advertisements and how it leads to massive brand recognition.

t: 'SNL' has a go at Amazon Go in spoof on how white and black shoppers may view 'Just Walk Out' tech – GeekWire
s: March 14, 2022 - “At an Amazon Go store, you can just walk in, grab what you want, put it in your bag and just go,” a voiceover says. “So I just grab what I want and leave? Wow, that’s so easy,” one white shopper (Heidi Gardner) says in the spoof. “Oh, so you want me to just take something and walk out? Nah, son,” says a black shopper (Kenan Thompson), before adding, “Nice try.” · Actress Zoë Kravitz (“The Batman,” “KIMI”) hosted “SNL...
